content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

```
function clean_column(col::String)::String
    col = lowercase(col)
    col = replace(col, r"^\s+", "")
    col = replace(col, r"\s+$", "")
    col = replace(col, r"\s+", "_")
    return col
end
```
This function takes a column name as an argument and returns the cleaned version of it. It first converts the column name to lowercase, then removes any leading or trailing whitespaces using regular expressions. Finally, it replaces any spaces and hyphens with an underscore.
